pageContext.claim: “We are taking some of the most dangerous ISIS fighters out. We've taken them out and we're putting them in different locations where it's secure.”
pageContext.analysis: This turned out not to be true. "The United States got only two high-value detainees out — far short of its goal," the New York Times reported. "The military had been making contingency plans to get a list of about five dozen of the highest-priority detainees from that group out of northern Syria since December...After Mr. Trump’s abrupt green light to Turkey, the military tried to carry out that aspiration....But after the Kurds acquiesced to those two transfers, they stopped cooperating with the United States in anger at what they saw as Mr. Trump’s betrayal, according to American officials."
